definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: It's the glorious duty for every soldier to defend our country against enemies.
sentences.chinese: 卫国抗敌是每个士兵应尽的光荣职责。

sentences.english: When the armies of fascism swept Asia, We fought with you to stop them.
sentences.chinese: 法西斯军队席卷亚洲的时候，我们和你们并肩抗敌。

sentences.english: The army defied the enemy's forces.
We need to prepare for an emergency.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎么说，我们需要为抗敌做准备。

definition: armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
facing a powerful enemy (idiom); fig. confronting grave difficulties/Enemy at the Gates, 1991 movie by Jean-Jacques Annaud
(literary) foreign aggression/external threat/humiliation inflicted by outsiders
to fight with all one's might
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
to be of one mind/to work as one
